In London, plays are such a hot ticket that people often line up around the block just to get in.

The program known as NT Live started this week with the performance of a classic tragedy.
NPR's Rob Gifford has our story.
London's National Theatre is following in the footsteps of the Metropolitan Opera in New York, which recently began beaming its operas around the world.

Helen Mirren swaps her crown as Elizabeth II in the movie ""The Queen"" for the colossal role of the Greek Queen Phedre, in the classic play of the same name by French writer Jean Racine.
I'm very happy to have the opportunity to play Phedre.

and all over the world, as well.
